column4: Hi. :) I'm trying to compile xchat 2.8, and it first said I didn't have a decent C compiler, so I got gcc( good enough?). Now it says "error: C compiler cannot create executables". Why, is there a way to fix this?
install build-essential
erm, sorry to ask again, but I'm a bit new to linux, which folder? the same? (xchat-2.8?)
it's a package you install, for example 'sudo apt-get install build-essential'
no, in order to compile things in Ubuntu you need that package
cool, np :)
do I need to relogin after it's done (the package you told me)?
no, should work straight away
need to install glib?
possibly.  The best way to install the required dependencies would be to 'sudo apt-get build-dep xchat'
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/4837/
Why won't it work?
hm. if everything worked without error it should be there.  Does 'ls /usr/bin/xchat' return anythibng?
'ls /usr/bin/*xchat*' ?
no, from the directory with the source code
seemes so, is there any clues in the output of the commands? or in the INSTALL file perhaps?
them I am at a loss.  perhaps 'sudo updatedb' then see if 'locate xchat | grep bin' returns anything
do you know of a package of xchat-2.8?
no
there you go, you could try backporting the feisty package
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=268687
no, follow that guide to build a package from feisty sources
